definition: to be bound to/to be sure to
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: As soon as you prove to be good, you will get more followers.
sentences.chinese: 如果事实证明你还不错，必定会有更多追随者。

sentences.english: A biological worker always makes it a point to record the time when a specimen in collected .
sentences.chinese: 生物工作者必定记下采得标本的时间。

sentences.english: Interest rates and inflation are both due to climb.
sentences.chinese: 利率和通胀率都必定上升。

sentences.english: Of course, what goes up must come down.
sentences.chinese: 当然，不可否认的是，跳上去就必定得落下来。
必定来出席我的寿辰宴会。

sentences.english: It must have been a wonderful chase.
sentences.chinese: 这必定是一场了不得的跟踪追击。

sentences.english: Everything has a benning has a end.
sentences.chinese: 也必定意味着前一事件的结束。

sentences.english: If heaven is a million years away, oh just call me and I make your day.
sentences.chinese: 纵使路途遥远千年万年，我也必定将你带入那片天堂。

sentences.english: Of course we help each other if necessary.
sentences.chinese: 当然，如若需要，我们必定相互帮助。

sentences.english: It's going to be interesting to see how it all connects.
sentences.chinese: 看它们之间如何连在一起必定很有意思。

sentences.english: Belief in the absurdity of existence must then dictate his conduct.
sentences.chinese: 如果他相信存在是荒谬的，那么他必定有所行动。

sentences.english: You must play a lot of golf after you get your sermons ready.
sentences.chinese: 写完讲章后，你必定很多时间打高尔夫球吧。

sentences.english: The environmental exposure doesn’t have to be as extreme as chowing down on a fungicide.
sentences.chinese: 环境暴露必定不像大量食入杀菌剂一样。

sentences.english: If your habits are self-destructive, you will fail in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的习惯是自我毁灭性的，你将来必定失败。

sentences.english: "Farmers could definitely get violent if their year's work is destroyed, " said Atta .
sentences.chinese: 一旦辛苦一年的成果被破坏，农人必定会变得凶暴。

definition: to be definitely able (to do sth)
to foreordain/to be bound to/to be destined to/to be doomed to/inevitably
most likely/mostly (in 8 or 9 cases out of 10)/vast majority
to be certain/to be positive/assuredly/definitely/to give recognition/to affirm/affirmative (answer)
